comments:
Build 20020312
When ever trying to bring up Help/Help Contents I receive an Action canceled 
message in the browser that is shown.  The only options that are available on 
the menu are Back and Forward.  Forward is disabled.  Selecting Back bring us a 
The page cannot be displayed error page.
I have IE 5.5 installed.  I have no proxy settings.
I set the Help preferences to log everything, stopped and restarted eclipse.  
The following is the log file entry that I receive:

Note that the launch command is a single line with the only spaces being in 
path names for things in Program Files.  Issuing this command on its own 
results in an unknown program error.

If I run the command with appropriate spaces, I get a Help window with the Back 
and Forward buttons enabled, but the content is blank.  I'm not even able to 
get a context menu by right clicking.

I do not think the help browser is a source problem here.  It is supposed to 
come up like that until it is called to load a page.

What locale are you running?

My locale is English United States for both my regional settings and my 
internet settings.

Thanks.

That looks like the problem.  The tomcat server we are running cannot bind to a 
port.

Could you provide OS and fixpack level that you are running.  Also any software 
firewall or strange TCP/dialing software on your machine?

Thanks, the log is great!
This may be caused by different things on the system: a non-standard TCP/IP 
stack, some firewalls, race conditions when closing and re-opening socket 
(having our imlementation in mind).
We should perhaps try changing the way out tomcat server selects a port number, 
as the current mechanism is not 100% bullet-proof.

I'm running NT 4.0 SP 6.  No firewall on my PC. TCP stack is standard NT.  I do 
have Hummingbird NFS client and we use Clear Case for our SCM which is kind of 
a networked file system.  Looking back at older catalina log files.  I see 
occasions where the port seemd to bind correctly.  The last time was 02/27.  
I'm not sure, but I was most likely on the 0214 build at that time.
Should be fixed in the 20020321 integration (stable) build.
